name: B. Same Parity Summands
statement:
You are given two positive integers n (1
le n
le 10^9) and k (1
le k
le 100). Represent the number n as the sum of k positive integers of the
same parity (have the same remainder when divided by 2).In other words,
find a_1, a_2,
ldots, a_k such that all a_i>0, n = a_1 + a_2 +
ldots + a_k and either all a_i are even or all a_i are odd at the same
time.If such a representation does not exist, then report it.
editorial:
Consider two cases: when we choose all odd numbers and all even numbers.
In both cases letâs try to maximize the maximum. So, if we choose odd
numbers, letâs try to take ones and the remainder . But we need to sure
that is greater than zero and odd. And in case of even numbers, letâs
try to take twos and the remainder . We also need to check that the
remainder is greater than zero and even. If none of these cases is true,
print "".
